intro: Correlliana multiflora, commonly known as the redroot morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically has heart-shaped leaves and produces vibrant pink to red flowers that bloom in the early morning. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
